DataElement.definition: The kind of substance holding another substance in solution or suspension to maintain a specimen in a viable state.

DataElementConcept.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension.

ObjectClass.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension.

Concepts.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.
A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.definition: A material that absorbs moisture from its surrounding environment.

Concepts.definition: A material that absorbs moisture from its surrounding environment.

ValueMeaning.definition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.13 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

Concepts.definition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

ValueMeaning.definition: Refers to samples that have been preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.

ValueMeaning.definition: The use of buffered formalin for preservation of tissue samples.

Concepts.definition: The use of buffered formalin for preservation of tissue samples.

ValueMeaning.definition: The use of unbuffered formalin for preservation of tissue samples.

Concepts.definition: The use of unbuffered formalin for preservation of tissue samples.

ValueMeaning.definition: A tissue sample that has been fixed with formalin.

Concepts.definition: A tissue sample that has been fixed with formalin.

ValueMeaning.definition: A water-soluble oily liquid, C5H8O2, containing two aldehyde groups, used as a disinfectant and as a fixative for biological tissues.

Concepts.definition: A water-soluble oily liquid, C5H8O2, containing two aldehyde groups, used as a disinfectant and as a fixative for biological tissues.

ValueMeaning.definition: Trade name for an aqueous, non-toxic tissue storage reagent that rapidly permeates tissues to stabilize and protect cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: Trade name for an aqueous, non-toxic tissue storage reagent that rapidly permeates tissues to stabilize and protect cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.definition: A ready-to-use reagent for the isolation of high-quality total RNA or the simultaneous isolation of RNA, DNA, and protein from biological samples. It is a monophasic solution of phenol and guanidine isothiocyanate.

Concepts.definition: A ready-to-use reagent for the isolation of high-quality total RNA or the simultaneous isolation of RNA, DNA, and protein from biological samples. It is a monophasic solution of phenol and guanidine isothiocyanate.

ValueMeaning.definition: A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: Per JK, added OCT Media alt name for CDS. mr

Concepts.definition: A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.

ValueMeaning.definition: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

Concepts.definition: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

ValueMeaning.definition: An organic, branched-chain alkane with five carbon atoms.

Concepts.definition: An organic, branched-chain alkane with five carbon atoms.

ValueMeaning.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
Not provided or available.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.definition: The gaseous state of liquid nitrogen with a temperature of -167 degrees Celsius.

Concepts.definition: The gaseous state of liquid nitrogen with a temperature of -167 degrees Celsius.

ValueMeaning.definition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to about -200 degrees Celsius.

Concepts.definition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.
A substance holding another substance in solution or suspension.
